thread.title: Westminster terror attack suspect named as Abu Izzadeen
thread.title_full: Westminster terror attack suspect named as Abu Izzadeen

author: Jake Kanter
title: Westminster terror attack suspect named as Abu Izzadeen
text:
Westminster attack suspect. PA 
This is the man that carried out the terror attack in the heart of London on Wednesday. 
He was shot dead by police after killing an officer with a knife in an attempted attack on the Houses of Parliament. Moments earlier he ploughed into pedestrians on Westminster bridge in a 4x4 vehicle. 
He was named by Channel 4 News as a prominent British-born Islamist extremist, but the broadcaster later rowed back from its report after it was disputed on Twitter. 
Now appears this might be erroneous. Will delete original tweet 
BBC Pakistan correspondent Secunder Kermani said a "reliable source" told him that the man Channel 4 named is in jail. ABC journalist Rym Momtaz echoed this account , claiming to have spoken to the individual's solicitor on Wednesday. 
I'm standing by my source - will hold my hands up if I'm wrong â€” Secunder Kermani (@SecKermani) March 22, 2017 
Sky News said police have identified the assailant but are yet to name him. Earlier in the day, Met Police Acting Deputy Commissioner Mark Rowley confirmed there was only one attacker and said investigations are ongoing. 
A Press Association photographer took images of the suspect receiving medical assistance outside the Palace of Westminster. Sprawled metres away from the police offer he killed, he died from his gunshot wounds. 
Moments earlier, a police officer could be seen standing over the attacker with his firearm. He appeared to be standing on the knife used in the attack. 
PA 
PA 
This story is developing...
